Package tools.io

Class MultiZipInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • tools.io.MultiZipInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, ExceptionInputStream
    public class MultiZipInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream
implements ExceptionInputStream
    Input stream for multiple zip files. It uses the ZipInputStream class to obtain data from a single zip file. Additionally, multiple zip files can be read as if they are one big file.

    Accepts files in the same format as produced by MultiZipOutputStream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiZipInputStream

        public MultiZipInputStream​(java.lang.String path,
                           boolean parted)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new zip reader with the path.
        If parted == true, then the reader will read multiple files with the same prefix, but a different part number.

        Example 1:
        Input files:
        • /some/path/data.zip
        Then read all the contents of the zip file via:
        new ZipReader("/some/path/data.zip", false)

        Example 2:
        Input files:
        • /some/path/data.zip.part000
        • /some/path/data.zip.part001
        • /some/path/data.zip.part002
        • /some/path/data.zip.part003
        Then read all the contents of the zip files via:
        new ZipReader("/some/path/data.zip", true)
        Parameters:
        path - The
        parted -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the first file does not exist, or if some IO error occured.

    • Method Detail

      • nextEntry

        public java.util.zip.ZipEntry nextEntry()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the next entry.
        The returned entry is the first entry of a possible block of entries with the same name and spread over separate files.
        Returns:
        The next entry.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some IO error occured.
